data.text: @torontolibrary @JohnTory The vaccine passports and mandates were never based on science. They don’t prevent transmission and no one is putting others at risk. While passports and mandates are fizzing out seemingly everywhere, Canada’s rule of law is under assault by political and partisan thuggery. https://t.co/yZdzVx9JVH

@JPBValery1 @JPBValery1 The Museum + Arts Pass (MAP) program, including Performing Arts Pass, is postponed until further notice. We look forward to bringing MAP back to our branches at a later date: https://t.co/oVtBqcfeRq -CP
@torontolibrary Any updates on The museum + Arts Passes program

@ComradeVero For the majority of the temporarily closed branches, yes. We will continue monitoring staffing levels for the ones that remain closed. Please check  https://t.co/09d2A6iXfG for details.  -CS
@ComradeVero @ComradeVero Hello, Select branches were temporarily closed due to COVID-19 related staffing shortages but many are reopening next week: https://t.co/oVtBqcfeRq -CS

@ComradeVero @torontolibrary Because there was a .005% chance of death by contracting COVID if you had 3 or more simultaneous comorbid conditions such as being morbidly obese or heavy smoker. Definitely NOT because there was a much more overwhelming chance of being killed on the drive going to work.
